reviews.text: The Concord Residence Inn is in the city where I work. During our historically early Nor'easter (Oct 29-30), I was unwilling to drive the 30 miles home at 2am after working the evening shift. After having issues with several other local (and lower cost) hotels - no power, and/or no available parking spots - I landed at the RI at around 3am.
reviews.title: Beautiful, spacious, sparkling clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: John at the desk was very friendly, and checked me in quickly. The room was BEAUTIFUL. King studio suite - you can see the hotel site photos for very accurate impressions. It was immaculate (it is a new property, after all). The TV was huge, shower was hot, the bed comfy. The kitchen and lounge area (which I didn't use at all) was spotless. I was told the included breakfast is very good, but I missed it, trying to sleep in.
reviews.title: Fantastic,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While costing more than I normally spend for an emergency winter lay-over, I would highly recommend this hotel - especially if you need an extended stay.
reviews.title: Nice, clean property

reviews.text: This was the nicest hotel we have ever stayed in! I still can't believe our luck, it was a Price line deal, and was less then half price. They even had a complimentary supper as well as breakfast. There was a full kitchen,with full size appliances, granite counters, Hugh flat screen tv,king size bed, and beautiful furnishings. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would love to stay here again.
reviews.title: Very nice and new. No complaints!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in desk, very friendly & helpful. Warm cookies and cider! A Saturday night stay, so no evening reception. Luckily got a great rate through Priceline, otherwise, this is one of the more expensive RI (as is the Portsmouth,NH location). Other positive reviews cover everything else.
reviews.title: Fairly new, quiet location
Staff couldn't have been nicer
reviews.text: Well not completely perfect...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a pretty great experience though
reviews.title: Exceptional

reviews.text: The property IS on 'business motel row' in this city with an interstate highway bordering the property, Still... as a commercial /LT Stay/ generic Marriorrt .
reviews.title: Stop Looking and Book Here

reviews.text: The facilities and the staff are indeed top notch.
reviews.title: Amazing place and staff

reviews.text: We did not have a ton of special requests,
reviews.title: Confidence in Concord

reviews.text: Lovely hotel with a modern decor and an outstanding kitchen. I would definitely stay again. The staff was friendly, the pool and gym was spotless. The fire pit patio area was very nice.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: Great service,clean room,and a very clean and well taken care of salt water pool. Staff was friendly and knew the area well.
reviews.title: nice getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was nearly the best we had ever stayed in. It was immaculately clean and comfortable.The staff was fabulous and our stay was like heaven. Is that too much praise? They deserve it. Great place to stay!
reviews.title: Incredibly clean and comfortable

reviews.text: What an excellent weekend we had. Thanks so much to all the staff from housekeeping to the front desk to the breakfast staff for being so friendly and outgoing. The room was so clean we couldn't find a sign that anyone had ever stayed there before- and the it was decorated very tastefully. It's close enough to the local ski areas. The staff was awesome to our 6 year old boy- and we'll definately be back.
reviews.title: Excellent Property, Great Service!

reviews.text: Brand new, contemporary, definitely worth staying here. I often stay at Marriotts and sister hotel chains with my points. I must say that this Residence Inn was amazing. The breakfast was outstanding, the modern decor and style of the hotel is on par with trendy hotels that I have stayed at in Europe and Asia. The salt-water pool and outdoor firepit were great touches.
reviews.title: Impressive, the nicest Residence Inn the I've ever stayed at.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really liked this hotel. Clean and new. We were at the back of the hotel and alhtough we could hear traffic noise while outside, we found inside the room to be very quiet.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: First time spending a week at this hotel. The grounds are lovely and quite a few immunities such as a fire pit that guests used every night. Quite comfy and very relaxing. Our suite was tastefully decorated and very cozy! The bed was very comfortable too. All in all a wonderful place to stay. Look forward to my next visit.
reviews.title: Home away from home!

reviews.text: Here we have a fairly new, modern Residence Inn, in the new modern, chic upscale design scheme they're using as they build new properties. Really, the place is very nice, almost luxurious feeling, new and should have been a very restful and relaxing retreat.
reviews.title: Modern, New Residence Inn - Beware of Freeway Noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For me, the drawback was that it sits right on top of I-93 and the noise from the traffic at all hours permeates the outside and inside of the hotel. The windows on the rooms don't have very good soundproofing so if you are light sleeper be sure to bring earplugs or you will hear car, motorcycle and truck traffic roaring by all night long - it doesn't really die down much at all overnight. This is certainly not the staff's fault although I don't know why hotel developers continue to locate new hotels smack dab on top of interstate highways like this.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff

reviews.text: I'm not sure what advice to give about finding a quiet room, other than to be as far away from the freeway side as possible. And if noise doesn't bother you, you'll love the place.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended, Very Good, But Can Do Better
